articles.author: Jon Kamp, José de Córdoba and Julie Wernau
articles.title: Mexican Drug Cartels Propel America's Fentanyl Crisis - The Wall Street Journal
articles.description: The Sinaloa and Jalisco organizations have taken over from Chinese sellers as a dominant source of the potent synthetic opioid, a leading cause of the U.S.’s record overdoses. Among the reasons, it is easier and less expensive to produce than heroin.

articles.author: Jessica Dickler
articles.title: Credit scores still sit at all-time high, despite some 'deterioration' in how Americans are faring financially - CNBC
articles.description: Even as consumer debt rises, the national average credit score still sits at an all-time high of 716, unchanged from a year ago, according to FICO.
articles.content:
Consumers are increasingly relying on credit cards to make ends meet, but it hasn't significantly impacted their financial standing at least when it comes to their credit rating.
